solution.text:
Longest line= AC = AB + _{{j}}_
By using Pythagoras theorem, \((AB+_{j}_)^2=AB^2+_{{j*7}}_^2\)
\(2*_{{j}}_*AB+_{j}_^2=_{{7*j}}_^2\)
\(AB=_{{j*24}}_\)
\(AC=_{{j*24}}_+_{j}_\)
\(AC=_{{j*25}}_\)
Now we can find cosA=\(AB\over AC\)=\(_{{j*24}}_\over _{{j*25}}_\)
similarly sinA=\(BC\over AC\)=\(_{{j*7}}_\over _{{j*25}}_\)
So, cosA-sinA=\(_{{17*j}}_\over _{{j*25}}_\)

content.text:
In a right angle triangle the smallest side is _{{j*7}}_cm long.
If the longest side is _{{j}}_ units more than the third side(AB),
find the value of \(cosA-sinA\)
